author: jwasinger
content:
One other reason that reads may not be that useful for speeding up execution:  if the state root calculation overhead dominates the block execution, it doesn't matter if we squeeze some extra performance out of the EVM execution.

In Geth, the initial performance numbers support this.  However, we are still optimizing things (especially state root calculation) so I can't say with 100% certainty just yet.

author: jwasinger
content: There could ofc exist pathological cases where including reads would yield a large speedup: e.g. if a block is full of transactions that perform lots of reads but don't change much of the state.
